Irving Independent School District added 14 new photos.
August 28 at 5:08 PM Â·

Our 2019-2020 LEAP (Leaders Excelling and Advancing Performance) graduates were recognized during the #myIrvingISD board meeting on Monday!

The program consists of differentiated leadership development curriculum, guest speaker sessions and leadership mentors, and an extensive capstone project designed to help the LEAPers excel in service to our students, staff and the boarder community of Irving ISD.

Congratulations and thanks for all you do to make our district better!

The program consists of differentiated leadership development curriculum, guest speaker sessions and leadership mentors, and an extensive capstone project designed to help the LEAPers excel in service to our students, staff and the boarder community of Irving ISD.

Congratulations and thanks for all you do to make our district better!

post_text:
â€¼ï¸BREAKING NEWSâ€¼ï¸

At tonight's regularly scheduled school board meeting, the Irving ISD Board of Trustees voted to extend remote learning for all students through September 25. This date represents the end of the first six weeks grading period. At this time, the in-person learning option would begin on Monday, September 28. This comes after careful review of the recommendation by Dallas County Health and Human Services that there not be any in-person learning at this time.

The Texas Education Agency has given local school districts authority to offer remote learning for all students for up to four weeks. Districts may extend the remote learning option for all students an additional four weeks with Board of Trustee approval. To extend the remote learning only option beyond eight weeks would require approval from the Texas Education Agency.

In addition, at the board meeting, trustees approved extracurricular activities to begin on September 7.

We will continue to update you, and we thank you for your patience and flexibility!
text:
â€¼ï¸BREAKING NEWSâ€¼ï¸

At tonight's regularly scheduled school board meeting, the Irving ISD Board of Trustees voted to extend remote learning for all students through September 25. This date represents the end of the first six weeks grading period. At this time, the in-person learning option would begin on Monday, September 28. This comes after careful review of the recommendation by Dallas County Health and Human Services that there not be any in-person learning at this time.

The Texas Education Agency has given local school districts authority to offer remote learning for all students for up to four weeks. Districts may extend the remote learning option for all students an additional four weeks with Board of Trustee approval. To extend the remote learning only option beyond eight weeks would require approval from the Texas Education Agency.

In addition, at the board meeting, trustees approved extracurricular activities to begin on September 7.

We will continue to update you, and we thank you for your patience and flexibility!

By order of the local health authority â€“ Dallas County Health and Human Services â€“ no school district in Dallas County shall open for in-person learning until after September 7. However, Irving ISD will start school as scheduled on August 17, and will provide remote learning ONLY for all students.

The district will continue to update you as we receive more guidance regarding in-person instruction, and if it can begin on September 8. Remote learning will continue as an option beyond September 8 for those parents who have selected the remote learning option for their child.

post_text:
Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from Irving ISD through email.

The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.
P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT.

post_text: Common symptoms of #COVID19 are fever, dry cough, & shortness of breath. If you have mild symptoms, call your doctor & #StayHome. If you develop serious symptoms, such as trouble breathing, pressure in the chest, or bluish lips or face, call your doctor & seek care immediately.

post_text:
Beginning April 6, the Irving ISD Tax Office will be closed for in-person transactions until further notice. Tax Office staff will be available by phone Mondays through Thursdays from 8 AM to 5 PM and on Fridays from 8 AM to 4:30 PM. Tax office staff can be reached at 972-600-5450. Please note, the Tax Office will be closed on Friday, April 10 for Good Friday.

To make a payment, taxpayers can use one of the following:

â€¢ Mail payments through the postal service.
â€¢ Use electronic forms of payment found at www.irvingisd.net/taxoffice.
â€¢ Pay by phone at 1-866-539-2020. You will need the bureau code 4921694, account number and the amount you are paying.
â€¢ Use the night drop to the right of the Tax Office door.

Gabriel Moussavi is a 6th grader at Travis Middle and is really enjoying learning from the comfort of home.

"I get do my work wherever I feel comfortable like the living room, dining room or my bed. If I need any help with my work, I can talk to my teacher through Zoom, like today."

#myIrvingISD is proud of Gabriel and his teachers for making learning fun and interactive, even if it's in a different space.

Technology distribution for elementary students who requested a device or hot spot has been scheduled for April 7 and 8. Hot spots are based on availability. Based on initial parent/teacher communication, devices have been reserved. If you reserved a device, your childâ€™s campus will communicate specific appointment times. If you have not communicated with your childâ€™s teacher that you need a device, please email your childâ€™s teacher by Thursday, April 2nd. Note: Hot spots will be distributed on a priority basis.

Tuesday, April 7: Brandenburg, Britain, Farine, Gilbert, Good, J. Haley, Keyes, Lee, Schulze and Townley
Wednesday, April 8: Barton, Brown, Clifton, Davis, Elliott, Hanes, T. Haley, Johnston, Kinkeade, Lively, Pierce, Stipes and Townsell

Grab and Go meals begin today from 10 AM to 1 PM at six Irving ISD schools:

- Houston Middle School (3033 West Country Club Drive, Irving 75038)
- Crockett Middle School (2431 Hancock Street, Irving 75061) - Bowie Middle School (600 East Sixth Street, Irving 75060)
- Lamar Middle School (219 Crandall Road, Irving 75060)
- Lee Elementary School (1600 Carlisle Street, Irving 75062)
- Keyes Elementary School (1501 North Britain Road, Irving 75061)

Students must be present to receive the meal but do NOT need their ID. Breakfast begins tomorrow, and you can pick up BOTH at the same time.

Meal menus available at www.irvingisd.net/learningplans

post_text:
BREAKING NEWS: Thank you for your understanding and patience as we navigate unchartered territories during the COVID-19 pandemic. Your support of Irving ISD is greatly appreciated! Our goal is to provide updates in a timely and efficient manner as we receive them. As such, we want to inform the Irving ISD community that Governor Abbott has just announced this morning, Monday, March 16, that all STAAR testing requirements have been waived for the 2019-2020 school year. The full press release can be read below.

Additionally, Superintendent Hernandez will attend a meeting with Dallas County city and health officials this Wednesday, March 18. She also participates in a daily conference call with the Texas Commissioner of Education. We will continue to keep you updated as we learn information from city, state and health officials. Please remember to practice social distancing during this time and stay safe and healthy!
text:
BREAKING NEWS: Thank you for your understanding and patience as we navigate unchartered territories during the COVID-19 pandemic. Your support of Irving ISD is greatly appreciated! Our goal is to provide updates in a timely and efficient manner as we receive them. As such, we want to inform the Irving ISD community that Governor Abbott has just announced this morning, Monday, March 16, that all STAAR testing requirements have been waived for the 2019-2020 school year. The full press release can be read below.

Additionally, Superintendent Hernandez will attend a meeting with Dallas County city and health officials this Wednesday, March 18. She also participates in a daily conference call with the Texas Commissioner of Education. We will continue to keep you updated as we learn information from city, state and health officials. Please remember to practice social distancing during this time and stay safe and healthy!

post_text: Irving ISD is in constant contact with local health officials to monitor the effects of Coronavirus (COVID-19). As of Friday, March 13, there are no known cases affecting the IRVING ISD Community. The health and safety of our students and staff remains our top priority. In the event of school closure, Irving ISD will provide resources to continue learning at home. We will keep you updated via School Messenger, our district social media platforms and on our website at www.IrvingISD.net.

post_text: LIVEğŸ§ğŸ¬ on Noggin Educational Foundation is our very own, Dr. Sneed-Echebelem speaking about dyslexia awareness and dyslexia education. Tune in now!!
shared_text:
Noggin Educational Foundation was live â€” at Noggin Educational Foundation.
January 28 at 5:00 PM Â· Grand Prairie, TX Â·

70-80% of people with poor reading skills, are likely Dyslexic. One in five students has a language based learning disability, Dyslexia being the most common.

In this episode we sat down with Dyslexia specialist from Irving Independent School District, Samantha Sneed-Echebelem and Linnea Oxley from School of Lexia.

Watch us live every Tuesday at 11:am - Noon CST on our Facebook page Noggin Educational Foundation. For more information about our show head to schooldazedshow.com

SPECIAL OFFER FOR SCHOOL DAZED LISTENERS! Audio books are a great way for people with dyslexia to access great books! Audible is offering a free audiobook download with a free 30-day trial to give you the opportunity to check out their service. Go to http://www.audibletrial.com/schooldazedshow to get yours!

Yesterday was the first #SigningDay of the year, and 8 #myIrvingISD scholar-athletes signed their letters of intent to take their talents to the next level. Congratulations to:

MacArthur High School
- Sarah Andrews, Baylor University (basketball)
- Hannah Gusters, Baylor University (basketball)
- Abigail Lewis, Southwestern Oklahoma State University (cross country/track)
- Annabel Westbrook, University of Texas at Tyler (soccer)

Nimitz High School
- Ricky Armenta, Dallas Christian College (baseball)
- Sherry Lindsey, Navarro College (softball)
- Greg Maskarinec, Texas Wesleyan University (baseball)
- Jaryn Towery, University of Texas at Dallas (volleyball)
